channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Biden slams Trump for offering 'nothing but failure and delusions' in the face of Covid-19
Biden on Trump: Talk about a know-nothing president
item.description: At a press conference in Delaware, Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden slammed President Trump's Covid-19 response and said he would like a real time fact checker for the debates.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi just handed Trump a campaign gift
India and China are squaring off in the Himalayas again. How worried should we be?
item.description: Two nuclear-armed powers, both run by nationalist governments at a time of economic tension, are once again squaring off along their shared border. Is this a recipe for disaster?

item.title: US markets think Biden is going to beat Trump
item.description: The presidential election is only two months away and the stock market is soaring.

item.title: Comedian-actor accused of exposing himself to multiple women
item.description: For actress Megan Drust, what happened between her and comedian Chris D'Elia is something she hasn't talked about for nearly a decade.

item.title: US imposes new restrictions on Chinese diplomats
item.description: US-based senior Chinese diplomats will be required to seek US government permission to engage in a number of routine activities, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo announced Wednesday -- the latest escalation amid worsening tensions between Washington and Beijing.

item.title: Good luck getting answers out of Russia on its latest high-profile poisoning
item.description: When the German government said Wednesday that Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny had been poisoned by the nerve agent Novichok, one thing was certain: The apparent murder attempt would become a full international crisis.

item.title: Pence's laughable response to questions about Trump's hospital visit
item.description: Vice President Mike Pence was asked Tuesday night about a report from a new book that he had been alerted to be ready to assume the powers of the presidency if Donald Trump had to be anesthetized in an unscheduled trip to Walter Reed hospital last November. Here's what he said:

item.title: A guide to 9 conspiracy theories Trump is currently pushing
item.description: President Donald Trump has been a conspiracy theorist for years. Perhaps never before, though, has he pushed so many conspiracy theories at one time.

item.title: 'It's blatant racism': Watch CNN anchor's reaction to Fox Host
item.description: CNN's Brianna Keilar discusses President Trump's rhetoric about protests and violence in the US following the killing of George Floyd and the shooting of Jacob Blake.

item.title: Two black holes merged 7 billion years ago. News of it just reached Earth in a historic discovery
R&B singer Akon is building a 'real-life Wakanda' worth $6 billion in Senegal
item.description: The award-winning R&B singer Akon is going ahead with ambitious plans to build a "futuristic" city in Senegal that he says will be a real-life version of Wakanda, the hi-tech nation portrayed in Marvel blockbuster "Black Panther."

item.title: Harry and Meghan sign production deal with Netflix
item.description: First, Netflix had "The Crown." Now it has Harry and Meghan.

item.title: Tyler Perry, who was once homeless, is now a billionaire, Forbes says
item.description: Tyler Perry enjoys how people sometimes explain his success.

item.title: Belgian town finds first mayor's heart hidden in local fountain
item.description: Locals in a Belgian city have believed for over a century that the heart of their first mayor was hidden within a public fountain.

item.title: Left behind because of Covid-19, a tiny dog travels 10,000 miles to rejoin her owners
item.description: All the best dogs find their way home eventually. Sometimes, like Pipsqueak the wiener dog, they've got to embark on a journey of more than 10,000 miles to get there.

item.title: Former friend and aide explains Melania's 'don't care' jacket
item.description: Former friend and aide to Melania Trump, Stephanie Winston Wolkoff, discusses the first lady's controversial "I really don't care do you?" jacket that she wore when she went to visit children who had been separated from their parents at the border due to her husband's immigration policies.

item.title: UAE denies knowledge of Hotel Rwanda film hero's arrest as family raise 'kidnap' fears
item.description: The United Arab Emirates has denied any involvement in the arrest of Hotel Rwanda film hero Paul Rusesabagina, saying he left Dubai legally last Friday on a private jet bound for the East African country.

item.title: US debt will exceed GDP next year for first time since end of WWII
item.description: The US debt is projected to exceed the size of the entire country's economy next year, the Congressional Budget Office said Wednesday.

item.title: Democrats announce historic fundraising haul
item.description: Joe Biden's presidential campaign and the Democratic National Committee announced it raised $364.5 million in August, an astonishing haul that Democrats believe was propelled by fundraising around the selection of California Sen. Kamala Harris as Biden's running mate and the Democratic convention.

item.title: 2016 Trump voter: This was my 'cross the line' moment
item.description: CNN's Alisyn Camerota speaks with a panel of six suburban White women that voted for President Donald Trump in 2016 about who they plan to vote for in the upcoming election.

item.title: David Byrne apologizes for donning blackface in 1984 video
item.description: Former Talking Heads frontman David Byrne has apologized for wearing black and brownface in an unearthed promotional video, calling it a "major mistake in judgement."

item.title: India steps up latest crackdown on Chinese apps
item.description: India has banned another collection of Chinese apps, including the mobile version of popular game PUBG, as tensions between the two countries rise again over disputed territory along their shared border.

item.title: Australia enters first recession in three decades
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic has officially pushed Australia into its first recession in nearly three decades.

item.title: Koreas brace for two typhoons in a week
item.description: Two powerful typhoons are hurtling toward the Korean Peninsula, threatening to bring more flooding and devastation to an area that has already been battered by one of the wettest monsoon seasons in recent history.

item.title: See Mike Pence's response when asked about Trump's hospital visit
item.description: Vice President Mike Pence said he couldn't recall if he was told to be on standby when President Trump visited Walter Reed hospital in November 2019 as a new book reports.

item.title: David Blaine flies to almost 25,000 feet by holding on to helium balloons
item.description: David Blaine just managed to do what so many can only dream of -- flying up into the air using a bunch of balloons.

item.title: NFL star takes Darwinian view on Covid-19
item.description: Minnesota Vikings quarterback Kirk Cousins is taking a controversial approach to Covid-19 for a man of his stature.

item.title: Intel has a new logo and jingle
item.description: Intel has a new logo, marking just the brand's third identity refresh in the past 51 years.

item.title: DJ Erick Morillo, known for 'I Like To Move It', dead at 49
item.description: 'I Like To Move It' DJ Erick Morillo has died at 49, according to Miami Beach Police.

item.title: NBA star puts Game 7 loss into perspective
item.description: Basketball is just a game and is trivial when compared to the social unrest taking place across the country.

item.title: Jill Biden on Trump's America: There is so much chaos
item.description: Jill Biden, the wife of Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden, says President Donald Trump and Education Secretary Betsy DeVos "didn't have a strategy" to reopen schools this fall amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Bubble tea and bears: Taiwanese vote on creative passport designs
item.description: Voted on by thousands of Taiwanese, the results of a "We are Taiwan" Passport Cover Design Competition are in -- and bubble tea fans won't be impressed.

item.title: How 11-year-old boy went from dancing barefoot in the streets to viral ballet star
item.description: In June, 11-year-old ballet dancer Anthony Mmesoma Madu was filmed barefoot, spinning and leaping gracefully in the air and landing in concrete, rain soaked puddles.

item.title: The UK's first Muslim female ref is proving people wrong
item.description: Football has never been just a hobby for Jawahir Roble; it's her passion.

item.title: Stephen Colbert opens up on loss of his father
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper has an emotional conversation with "The Late Show" host Stephen Colbert about grief, loss and healing. Watch "Full Circle" every Monday, Tuesday and Friday at 6pm E.T.

item.title: After 16 years, Britain's hit dancing show will finally feature a same-sex couple
item.description: Olympic gold medal-winning boxer Nicola Adams will become the first celebrity to dance with a same-sex partner on the UK's wildly popular talent series "Strictly Come Dancing," 16 years after the show first aired.

item.title: Big Sean regrets 'IDFWU' after Rivera's death
item.description: Hip-hop star Big Sean has revealed his regret over making "I Don't F*** With You," the breakup anthem many interpreted as being about his former fiancée, the late Naya Rivera.

item.title: Chelsea buy Danish international for 'record transfer fee for the women's game'
item.description: Pernille Harder has signed for Chelsea from Wolfsburg for a "record transfer fee for the women's game," according to the German side's sporting director.

item.title: CNN fact checker: 'It's almost too stupid to fact-check'
item.description: CNN's Daniel Dale fact-checks the disinformation about Vice President Joe Biden spread by President Trump and members of the GOP in interviews and on social media.

item.title: Like you've never seen him before, Mourinho steals show
item.description: Jose Mourinho peers disapprovingly over the top of his glasses, glaring at the television in his swanky new office.

item.title: DraftKings shares soar after Michael Jordan becomes an investor and adviser
item.description: Hall-of-Fame basketball legend Michael Jordan will be an investor and special adviser to the board of sports-betting company DraftKings, the company announced Wednesday.

item.title: Analysis: Nancy Pelosi just handed Trump a campaign gift
First known Covid death tied to huge motorcycle rally reported
item.description: The first known Covid-19 death stemming from last month's Sturgis Motorcycle Rally was reported in Minnesota, the state's health department said.

item.title: CDC tells states to prep for vaccines as soon as late October
item.description: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has told public health officials around the United States to prepare to distribute a potential coronavirus vaccine as soon as late October. It also provided planning scenarios to help states prepare.

item.title: Billionaire's son indicted in college scam
item.description: Prosecutors announced Wednesday that another parent has been indicted in the college admissions cheating case, accusing him of paying hundreds of thousands of dollars to a Georgetown University coach to help his daughter get accepted to the school as a tennis recruit.

item.title: 'Game of Thrones' producers to adapt Chinese sci-fi trilogy for Netflix
item.description: The Chinese science fiction trilogy "The Three-Body Problem" has won awards around the world and been heralded by fans including Barack Obama and sci-fi giant George R. R. Martin.

item.title: Why the green fashion movement needs plus-size people
item.description: As a person who has lived through many shifts in the fashion industry, I have often seen new trends positioned as a move towards making the industry more inclusive.
